segments.text: I can't believe how much water is pouring out of that sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying a plate like nothing's wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the puddle getting bigger and bigger, and she's just ignoring it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really focused on her task, or maybe she's just had a long day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so quiet, trying not to draw any attention to themselves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit happy that they're being so clever about getting those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really stretching to reach the jar, and the stool looks so unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they'll be able to get away with it this time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so hopeful, like she's waiting for something really special.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they don't make too much of a mess, but it's already a mess with all that water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation is just so unexpected and a bit funny.
segments.speaker: PAR
